text: The arrondissement of Foix is an arrondissement of France. It is part of the Ariège département. Its capital, and the prefecture of the department, is the city of Foix. ==History== When the Ariège department was created on 17 February 1800, the arrondissement of Foix was part of that original department. ==Geography== The arrondissement of Foix has the Pamiers arrondissement to the north, the Aude department to the east, the Pyrénées- Orientales department to the southeast, Andorra to the south, Spain to the southwest and the Saint-Girons arrondissement to the west. It is the largest of the arrondissements of the department, with an area of , but it is the second in population, after Pamiers, with 51,473 inhabitants and a density of inhabitants/km². ==Composition== ===Cantons=== After the reorganisation of the cantons in France, Décret n° 2014-174 du 18 février 2014 portant délimitation des cantons dans le département de l'Ariège cantons are not subdivisions of the arrondissements so they could have communes that belong to different arrondissements. In the arrondissement of Foix, there are 4 cantons whose communes are in the arrondissement: Haute-Ariège, Foix, Pays d'Olmes and Sabarthès as can be seen in the following table: Communes in the cantons by arrondissements No. Canton Foix Pamiers Saint-Girons Total 1 Haute-Ariège 48 48 2 Couserans Est 13 24 37 3 Foix 6 6 4 Pays d'Olmes 23 23 5 Sabarthès 32 32 6 Val d'Ariège 13 15 28 ===Communes=== The arrondissement of Foix has 135 communes; they are (with their INSEE codes): #
